title: Triggered (book)
deleted: Trump Jr appeared as the warm-up act for his father's “Save America Rally” on the National Mall, a short walk from the United States Capitol. Sharing conspiracy theories about a stolen election, Trump Jr. turned on the Republicans who, as he spoke, were preparing to confirm Joe Biden as the winner of the 2020 election. “The people who did nothing to stop the steal. This gathering should send a message to them: This isn’t their Republican party any more. This is Donald Trump’s.”<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/07/briefing/white-house-capitol-donald-trump-jon-ossoff.html</ref>  Echoing angry rhetoric from ''Triggered'', he added: “If you’re gonna be the zero and not the hero, we’re coming for you and we’re going to have a good time doing it!”<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/06/us/politics/trump-speech-capitol.html</ref>

The incendiary misinformation from the Trump rally set in motion [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|hours of violence and chaos]] where a mob of right-wing [[Make America Great Again|MAGA]] supporters, [[White supremacy|white supremacist]], and [[Neo-Nazism|Neo-Nazis]] stormed the Capitol and took control of the Senate chamber as Senators and Vice President [[Mike Pence]] fled to safety. A Capitol police officer was killed when he was beaten to death, and four others died. On January 6, 2021, a harsh reality violently collided with the [[Alternative facts|alternative reality]] Trump Jr. has promoted in interviews, on social media, and in ''Triggered''.

Following the riots, President Trump was [[Second impeachment of Donald Trump|impeached]] for "incitement of insurrection" against the U.S. government and "lawless action at the Capitol." D.C. Attorney General Karl Racine told the media, "Donald Trump Jr., Giuliani, even the president of the United States, were calling on their supporters and hate groups to go to the Capitol and, in Rudy Giuliani’s words exercise ‘combat justice.' We’re going to investigate not only the mobsters but also those who invited the violence."<ref>https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-giuliani-trump-jr-investigated-capitol-riots-dc-attorney-general</ref>
